definition[0]: to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time
example[0]: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
example[1]: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
definition[1]: to find information or the truth about something or someone
example[2]: The inquiry unearthed some disturbing evidence.
